question.title: Spring Boot Application Fails with java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/inject/Provider at Startup
question.body:
I'm working on a Spring Boot application using Spring Cloud Netflix Eureka. When I try to run the application, I get the following error:

org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'restTemplateDiscoveryClientOptionalArgs'...
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/inject/Provider
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: jakarta.inject.Provider

Here’s the full stack trace snippet:

Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: jakarta/inject/Provider
    at java.base/java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
    ...
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: jakarta.inject.Provider
    at java.base/jdk.internal.loader.BuiltinClassLoader.loadClass(BuiltinClassLoader.java:641)

I’ve already tried adding the following dependency to my pom.xml:

<dependency>
  <groupId>jakarta.inject</groupId>
  <artifactId>jakarta.inject-api</artifactId>
  <version>2.0.1</version>
</dependency>

After that, I ran mvn clean install and re-ran the application, but the error still persists.

Stack:

  • Java 17
  • Spring Boot 3.x
  • Spring Cloud Netflix Eureka
  • Maven

Notes:

  • I'm using Spring Boot 3.x with Spring Cloud Netflix Eureka.
  • This error occurs at runtime when initializing the application context.

question_comments.body: I don't get why/what Maven has to do with that. Maven is for building applications (and resolving dependencies during that process). As soon as you run your application your application server is responsible for provisioning your dependencies.
Spring Boot version: 3.2.0  Spring Cloud version (via BOM): 2023.0.1
What version of spring cloud are you using? What version of spring boot 3 specifically?
